lines.text: Cinderella is off to the ball

[his top hat's flat]
Hey, I can't get this thing open. Anybody got a tire iron?
Oh no, I couldn't trust myself next to that dress.
I'm going to spill champagne from Hamburg to Munich. Fall in love with every girl I meet. I'm going to live!
I'll drink to what I value most. The three of us. To us. Not from day to day now, but year to year.
I drink to those who think of home tonight. I drink to the peace they hope to find at home now that peace has come to them at war.

[At attention]
Major, now that the war is over, can I call you "father" again?
